title: Document sv task in README and PRODUCT_SPECIFICATION
Spec v1 TUI UX + layout
body:
Scope: fullscreen split view (list left, detail right) + narrow mode single pane
Keymap: j/k, arrows, / filter, esc clear, q quit, r reload, ? help
Visual hierarchy: status pill, id, title, workspace; metadata row in detail
Error states: empty, load error, watch error, no selection
Deliverable: UX spec doc with wireframe sketches + keymap table
Acceptance: doc reviewed, covers v1 read-only and v2 actions placeholder

title: Perf plan + budgets for task TUI
body:
Targets: cold start <150ms @1k tasks, <300ms @5k; keypress-to-frame <16ms; reload <50ms
Strategy: retained caches + differential render + no idle ticks
Snapshot-first load; avoid log fold on startup
Profiling: SV_TASK_PROFILE=1 timing logs (load/parse/render)
Acceptance: perf plan documented + profiling spec + risk list

title: TUI architecture + module layout
body:
Stack: ratatui + crossterm + notify (debounced)
Modules: ui/model.rs, ui/view.rs, ui/input.rs, ui/style.rs, ui/cache.rs
Data flow: TaskStore -> view model -> render tree
Threading: background loader + channel to UI loop
Acceptance: architecture note + module boundaries + data structs

title: Data loading + snapshot strategy
body:
Priority: .git/sv/tasks.snapshot.json then .tasks/tasks.snapshot.json
Fallback: fold log only if no snapshot (with warning banner)
Selection persistence: keep by task id on reload
Sort order: status rank -> updated_at desc -> id
Acceptance: spec for data sources + selection rules + sort rules

title: Renderer: list/detail + caching + virtualization
body:
Render only visible list window + detail viewport
Cache list rows by (task_id, width, selected)
Cache detail body by (task_id, width)
Markdown render cached; fallback to wrapped text if perf fails
Acceptance: renderer plan + cache invalidation rules

title: File watch + reload pipeline
body:
Watch: .tasks/tasks.jsonl, .tasks/tasks.snapshot.json, .git/sv/tasks.*
Debounce reload 150-300ms; coalesce bursts
On change: background reload -> UI message -> swap model
Handle watch errors gracefully in status banner
Acceptance: watch spec + error handling plan

title: Filter + status shortcuts behavior
body:
Fuzzy filter over id + title; incremental search
Quick status filters: o=open, p=in_progress, c=closed, a=all
Clear: esc; toggle: /; indicator row in header
Acceptance: filtering spec + keymap integration

title: Docs update for task viewer
body:
Add docs/task_viewer.md: UX, keymap, perf budgets, data sources
Update docs/prd-tasks.md with TUI entry + v1/v2 scope
Update docs/README.md index
Acceptance: docs merged and linked

title: Test plan for TUI logic
body:
Unit tests for filter, sort, selection preservation
Cache invalidation tests (width change, selection change)
No heavy e2e; note manual UI checks
Acceptance: test plan doc + initial tests implemented

title: v2 actions spec: start/close/comment
body:
Read-only v1; v2 adds start/close/comment actions
Design: use existing TaskStore ops (no shelling)
Confirm status transitions + actor handling
Acceptance: v2 spec + safety prompts

title: Add additional TUI commands
body:
We want the following commands added to the TUI:
- 'n' to add a new task, takes you to a TUI wizard for adding title, priority, related tasks/epics, and description etc. Based on the commands available. The only required one is TITLE. 
- 'p' to set/change priority on currently seelcted task
- 'e' to edit the task, using an inline editor similar to the one we can be using for the 'Add new task TUI'

title: Epic: Additional TUI commands
body:
Epic to deliver new task creation and editing commands in the TUI.

Scope
- Add 'n' new task wizard (title required; optional priority/relations/description).
- Add 'p' change priority for selected task.
- Add 'e' inline edit for selected task.
- Update keybindings/help so users can discover new commands.
- Add reasonable test coverage for the new flows.

title: TUI: New task wizard ('n')
body: Add a TUI flow for creating a new task. Required field: title. Optional fields: priority, related tasks/epics, description. Support cancel/back and confirm before create. Persist via existing task creation pathway.

title: TUI: Change priority ('p')
body: Add a command to set/change priority for the currently selected task. Provide a small priority picker and persist via sv task update. Handle cancel and no-op when unchanged.

title: TUI: Inline edit selected task ('e')
body: Add inline editor for selected task (title and description at minimum). Reuse/new component similar to new task wizard; require confirmation before save. Handle cancel and validation errors.

title: TUI: Update keybindings/help for n/p/e
body: Expose new commands in the TUI help/command list and any on-screen hints. Keep language short and consistent with existing UX.

title: Tests: TUI new/edit/priority flows
body: Add or extend tests to cover new task wizard, priority change, and inline edit flows. Focus on validation (title required), cancel/no-op behavior, and persistence.

title: TUI: Shared editor components
body: Extract or build shared TUI components/state for task create/edit flows (fields, validation, navigation, confirm/cancel). Used by new task wizard and inline edit.
